meaningMnemonic: Your new <radical>car</radical> doesn’t <radical>mix</radical> well with the other cars in your garage because its color is in stark <kanji>contrast</kanji> to the others. All of your other cars are pristine white in color, but this new car is a mix of lots of colors. It almost looks like a peacock or something it’s so colorful. Such a contrast.
readingMnemonic: What did I say this car looks like? Oh that’s right, a pea<reading>cock</reading> (かく). This car looks like a peacock. It’s the color of a peacock and you’ll look like you’re peacocking when you’re out on the town driving it. It really is such a stark <kanji>contrast</kanji> to like, every other car out there.
